poem:
### Warning

In the shadows of America,
where whispers turn to roars,
a warning sings:
blood upon the ballot,
violence beneath the stars.
Infiltrator's whisper,
a sinister chorus,
rekindles dread—
hatred dressed in uniforms,
waiting at the gates.
Be afraid,
says the morning paper.
Hold your breath,
the past is not past yet.
